START.question: Do you think there is anything you are experiencing at this very moment, or is that uncertain?

options.label: I don’t think there is anything real to experience

Q2.question: Right now, does what you experience feel like one continuous, unified whole, or like many separate things?

Q2a.question: Is this because everything genuinely feels unified, or because you can’t distinguish parts yet?

Q3.question: Do some things happen or appear again, or is everything always completely new?

options.label: Some things happen or appear again

Q4.question: When things seem to repeat, do any persist as the same individual, are they recurring instances of a kind, or is it impossible to tell?

Q5a.question: Do repeating things have a fact of the matter about their identity, or is the distinction confused or meaningless?

options.label: There is a fact but inaccessible

Q5b.question: Is the inability to tell due to perception limits or impossible in principle?

Q6.question: Do things persist when not observed, or only exist while noticed?

Q6a.question: Is uncertainty about persistence due to conceptual confusion or genuine difficulty?

Q7.question: Are recurring patterns imposed by the mind, or exist independently?

Q7a.question: Are patterns arbitrary, or shaped by experience?

Q7b.question: If kinds exist independently, do they exist apart from instances, only in instances, or not at all?

options.label: Do not exist as real kinds

Q8.question: Do persisting things exist only because minds perceive, independently of minds, or depend on both?

options.label: Depend on both minds and reality

Q9.question: Do mind-dependent things rely on my own mind, minds in general, or collective/social minds?

Q10.question: Do you perceive mind-independent things exactly, or could perception misrepresent them?

Q11.question: Do mind-independent things appear as they are, or only through how they appear?

Q12.question: Do appearances give access to reality, is reality beyond reach, or is the question meaningless?
